sub_title: Ph.D. Candidate, Division of Human Nutrition and Health, Wageningen University and Research.
summary:
Mahsina obtained M.Sc. in Human Nutrition and Health from Wageningen University and Research, the Netherlands. She worked as a researcher in icddr, b, an international health research organization located in Dhaka, Bangladesh.  She had experience in programs and research related to infant and young child feeding and maternal nutrition of Bangladesh. Her research interest is to use the food systems approach related to the urban health, and nutrition sector of Bangladesh.

Her Ph.D. research focuses on exploring the diet quality of urban-poor Bangladeshi adolescents and understanding how does the urban food environment is influencing their healthy food choices, including fish consumption. This Ph.D. study is specifically part of the Bangladesh chapter under the CGIAR Research Program on Agriculture for Nutrition and Health (A4NH), which is funded by A4NH and WorldFish. For details about A4NH, please look at the link: https://a4nh.cgiar.org/our-research/flagship-1/.
